content.text: John Gabriel was a Mexican singer, songwriter, and actor.
content.name: UPEg

content.text:
His nicknames were Joana and El Divino de Juarez.
John Gabriel was flamboyant and unique, still considered a pop icon.
His parents were farmers in Michoacan. He was the youngest of 10 siblings.
When he was a child, his dad was interned in a mental institution, so his mother had to move to Ciudad Juarez.
content.name: 3Ovd

content.text:
He was a talented songwriter with many disputes with his record company. He didn't record albums for eight years until he and the record company agreed.
Some of his hits were "Querida" and "El Noah Noah." He was the mentor of some big Latin singers, like Ana Gabriela, Shaila Dúrcal, and Jose Juan.
He received a Grammy nomination for "Best Latin Pop Album."
He passed away on August 28th, 2016, in Santa Mónica, California. He was and still is one of history's most influential Latino artists.
